fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`PEXT r32a, r32b, r/m32`
`PEXT r64a, r64b, r/m64`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: PEXT uses a mask in the second source operand (the third operand) to transfer either contiguous or non-contiguous bits in the first source operand (the second operand) to contiguous low order bit positions in the destination (the first operand). For each bit set in the MASK, PEXT extracts the corresponding bits from the first source operand and writes them into contiguous lower bits of destination operand. The remaining upper bits of destination are zeroed.
